item.title: Alucinara
item.description: Overview Alucinara, or Alucinara Energy, is a type of energy characterised by the alteration of natural processes which would act differently without its influence.

item.title: Botanists
item.description: %% What are the significant features which make this relevant to the plot? What patterns are there when it comes to description and properties?

item.title: Cloud Gnats
item.description: Overview Cloud Gnats are animal-like apparitions made of alucinariferous dust. They commonly appear as small animals, standing upright with their abdomen tapering off into a wispy tail.

item.title: Heirarchy of Beings
item.description: Overview In this note, I will be describing the cosmological heirarchy of beings, according to the creation story linked below. It goes, in order from highest to lowest, through the more powerful and important beings in reality.

item.title: History of the Morellic Minikin
item.description: Overview This note goes over the history of the Morellic Minikin. It explains their divergence from the Móra riSéwi, their hybridisation with the Western Kaśtaira, and the founding of Sarvara.

item.title: Ikplik
item.description: %% What are the significant features which make this relevant to the plot? What patterns are there when it comes to description and properties?

item.title: Minikin
item.description: Overview Minikin are a small rodent species native to the 2nd Realm. They are arboreal omnivores which tend toward eating nuts and other plants, and descended from red squirrels from the 0th realm.

item.title: Morellic Minikin
item.description: %% What are the significant features which make this relevant to the plot? What patterns are there when it comes to description and properties?

item.title: Mushrooms
item.description: Overview Mushrooms are the fruiting bodies of many fungal species. They grow to release spores, which are released from a wide surface to be blown away by the wind.

item.title: Naíru
item.description: Overview Naíru ( Proto-Nairuan: ‘The Farm,’ *na-ïru), was one of the greatest city-states of the Oyhólıru. It was situated on the western shore of the Naíruan Peninsula, just above the equator on the Natswh’kara river.

item.title: Pebble Spires
item.description: Overview Pebble Spires are a phenomenon caused when rocks interact with alucinara. They are largely benign, but can pose danger when toppled.

item.title: Sarvara
item.description: Overview Sarvara ( Sarvaran: ‘Our Valley City,’ Sarvárą < *ësa-ëlbhu-aazan) was a settlement founded by the Morellic minikin. It was built on the Abhmýra river, experiencing seasonal floods.

item.title: Sky Islands
item.description: Overview Generally, sky islands are large animal-shaped islands which float above the surface of the ground. They often feature self-sustaining ecosystems atop them, with a forest or grassland on the topside, and a rocky underside which changes shape due to Alucinara influence.

item.title: The Creation Story
item.description: Overview In this note, I will describe the canonical creation story. In-world, it is believed by the Morellic Minikin, but was diverged from or was abandoned by many other groups who believe other stories.

item.title: The Móra riSéwi Tribe
item.description: Overview The Móra riSéwi minikin ( Old Morellic: ‘Children of Mora,’ Móra riSéwi < *moza li-sevi) were a nomadic tribe from around the time of Naíru.

item.title: The Petrified Child
item.description: Overview The Petrified Child ( Sarvaran: Oį́n aStéyą < *uinh sëti-eyan) is a supernatural being or deity concerned with the regulation and destruction of evil.

item.title: The Sarvaran Calendar
item.description: Overview The Sarvaran Calendar is a calendar created by the Sarvaran minikin. Year 0 took place on the founding of the city, years before the founding are referred to with the acronym ‘BS,’ meaning ‘Before Sarvara.

item.title: title
item.description: The Oyhólıru Minikin The Oyhólıru ( Proto-Naíruan: ‘People,’ *o-yhólıru) minikin were a tribe native to the Naíruan Peninsula and surrounding area, and were well known for their societal and industrial efficiency.

item.title: Watchstones
item.description: Overview Watchstones ( Sarvaran: ‘The Seeing Stones,’ Oį́n Eyą́nith Atį́mar < *uinh eyanitu atëmil) are artificial patrols invented by the Sarvaran minikin for the purpose of giving The Petrified Child a greater visual range.
